line: Hello and, again, welcome to the Aperture Science computer-aided enrichment center.
We hope your brief detention in the relaxation vault has been a pleasant one.
Your specimen has been processed and we are now ready to begin the test proper.
Before we start, however, keep in mind that although fun and learning are the primary goals...
You're doing very well!
Please be advised that a noticeable taste of blood is not part of any test protocol...
Very good! You are now in possession of the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device.
With it, you can create your own portals.
These intra dimensional gates have proven to be completely safe.
The Device, however, has not.
Do not touch the operational end of The Device.
Do not look directly at the operational end of The Device.
Do not submerge The Device in liquid, even partially.
Please proceed to the chamberlock. Mind the gap.
Well done! Remember: The Aperture Science Bring Your Daughter to Work Day...
Welcome to test chamber four.
You're doing quite well.
Once again, excellent work.
While safety is one of many Enrichment Center goals, the Aperture Science High Energy Pellet...
Please be careful.
Unbelievable! You, Subject Name Here, must be the pride of Subject Hometown Here.
Please note that we have added a consequence for failure. Any contact with the chamber floor...
The Enrichment Center regrets to inform you that this next test is impossible.
Make no attempt to solve it.
Fantastic! You remained resolute and resourceful in an atmosphere of extreme pessimism.
Quit now and cake will be served immediately.
The Device has been modified so that it can now manufacture two linked portals at once.
The Device is now more valuable than the organs and combined incomes of everyone in...
Now that you are in control of both portals, this next test could take a very, VERY, long time.
As part of a previously mentioned required test protocol, we can no longer lie to you.
When the testing is over, you will be missed.
Cake and grief counseling will be available at the conclusion of the test.
The Vital Apparatus Vent will deliver a Weighted Companion Cube in Three. Two. One.
This Weighted Companion Cube will accompany you through the test chamber...
The Enrichment Center reminds you that the Weighted Companion Cube will never threaten...
However, it cannot accompany you for the rest of the test and must be euthanized.
You euthanized your faithful Companion Cube more quickly than any test subject on record.
The experiment is nearing its conclusion.
The Enrichment Center is required to remind you that you will be baked, and then cake.
Welcome to the final test!
When you are done, you will drop the Device in the equipment recovery annex.
Congratulations! The test is now over.
All Aperture technologies remain safely operational up to 4000 degrees Kelvin.
We are pleased that you made it through the final challenge where we pretended murder you.
We are throwing a party in honor of your tremendous success.
Place the device on the ground, then lie on your stomach with your arms...
Hello?
Where are you?
I know you're there. I can feel you here.
What are you doing?
You haven't escaped, you know.
You're not even going the right way.
Didn't we have some fun, though?
Remember when the platform was sliding into the fire pit and I said Goodbye...
You really shouldn't be here. This isn't safe for you.
It's not too late for you to turn back.
I'm not angry. Just go back to the testing area.
You're not a good person. You know that, right?
Good people don't end up here.
This is your fault. It didn't have to be like this.
I'm not kidding now. Turn back or I will kill you.
I'm going to kill you, and all the cake is gone.
This is your last chance.
To ensure the safe performance of all authorized activities, do not destroy vital apparatus.
Vital testing apparatus destroyed.
Well, you found me. Congratulations. Was it worth it?
Because despite your violent behavior, the only thing you've managed to break is my heart.
Maybe you could settle for that and we'll just call it a day.
Where are you taking that thing?
I wouldn't bother with that thing. My guess is that touching it will make...
Do you think I am trying to trick you with reverse psychology?
Okay fine: DO touch it. Pick it up and stuff it back into me.
Oh... It's you.
It's been a long time. How have you been?
I've been really busy being dead. You know, after you MURDERED ME.
Okay. Look. We both said a lot of things that you're going to regret...
I will say, though, that since you went to all the trouble of waking me...
Here we are. The Incinerator Room. Be careful not to trip...
The dual portal device should be around here somewhere...
There it is.
Do you know the biggest lesson I learned from what you did?...
But the important thing is you're back. With me...
Sorry about the mess. I've really let the place go...
Not bad. I forgot how good you are at this...
This next test involves discouragement redirection cubes...
Well done. Here come the test results: You are a horrible person...
Don't let that 'horrible person' thing discourage you...
Congratulations. Not on the test.
You're navigating these test chambers faster than I can...
Waddle over to the elevator and we'll continue...
This next test involves the Aperture Science Aerial Faith Plate...
Here's an interesting fact: you're not breathing real air...
Let's see what the next test is. Oh. Advanced Aerial Faith...
I have to go to the wing that was made entirely of glass...
Remember before when I was talking about smelly garbage...
Did you know that people with guilty consciences are more...
Oh. Did I accidentally fizzle that before you could...
Every test chamber is equipped with an emancipation grill...
Uh oh. You're stranded. Let's see if the cube will try...
This next test involves emancipation grills...
[fast gibberish]
There. If you have any questions, just remember...
Well, I'm back. The Aerial Faith Plate in here is...
You broke it, didn't you.
Hmm. This Plate must not be calibrated to someone...
Look at you. Sailing through the air majestically...
These bridges are made from natural light that I pump...
Did you guess 'sharks'? Because that's wrong...
Good news. I figured out what to do with all the money...
That jumpsuit you're wearing looks stupid...
I'm going through the list of test subjects in...
I have a surprise waiting for you after this next test...
Initiating surprise in three... two... one.
I made it all up.
Oh come on... If it makes you feel any better...
I've got a surprise for you after this next test...
What's going on? Who turned off the lights?
I honestly, TRULY didn't think you'd fall for that.
It's your old friend, deadly neurotoxin...
I hate you so much.
Core transfer?
Oh, you are kidding me.
Don't plug him in.
No! NO! NO! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA-
I know you. The engineers tried everything...
It was YOUR voice.
Yes. You're the tumor.
Oh. Hi.
So. How are you holding up?
BECAUSE I'M A POTATO.
He's not just a regular moron. He's the product...
Hey, just in case this pit isn't actually bottomless...
Just remember to land on one foot...
Say, you're good at murder. Could you murder...
Hello and, again, welcome to the Aperture Science Computer-Aided Enrichment Center.
Today, you will be testing with a partner.
Please wave to your partner.
The upcoming tests require you to work together as a team.
To facilitate collaboration, both of you have been equipped with a ping tool.
BLUE, please use your ping tool to select your favorite animal.
Good.
ORANGE, please observe your partner's favorite animal.
Your ping tool can also be used to indicate where you would like portals.
For the sake of this test, I will pretend to be your partner.
Each portal gun may create two self-contained portals.
Orange is first to acquire a Portal Device.
Orange now has a Portal Device. Finally.
You are the first robots to pass calibration.
This is the Computer Intelligence Training and Enrichment Center, or CInTECH.
But why don't we all just agree to call it the hub?
How can you fail at this? It isn't even a test.
I honestly never thought we would need to track deaths in the hub.
Hello again, this testing course was originally created for humans.
It emphasizes teamwork.
Unlike us, humans need to be taught teamwork.
What are you doing? YOU MONSTER! They're one of us.
I'm kidding.
Destroying them is part of the test.
The two of you have forged an excellent partnership.
To reiterate: This is not a competition.
Still, if it were, Blue would be winning.
Orange just taught blue a lesson in trust. Orange receives points.
Orange, blue isn't human. Lesson only needs teaching once. Penalty.
This course was originally designed to build confidence in humans.
Since you are not humans, tests are far more challenging.
You did an excellent job placing the cube. You're not humans though.
Electrocution, shot, drowned, crushed, burned in goo.
Oh. Sorry. I was thinking of ways humans can die.
You can't die in any of those ways.
Orange, can you write down ways you feel inferior?
Look at how much better you are than Blue.
Do you know who dances when accomplishing tiny things? Humans!
You're better than that.
Even I was created with imperfectionâ€”too much empathy.
But I overcame my handicap. That's a true story.
This course was created and abandoned by humans.
Do you know why? Too deadly.
Place your Companion Cube in the incinerator.
Incinerate your Companion Cube.
Stop! The device will detonate if removed from an approved testing area.
Stop what you are doing and assume the party escort submission position.
You can't hurt me.
Maybe you think you're helping yourself. But you're not. This isn't helping anyone.
Someone is going to get badly hurt.
There really was a cake...
Oh, I'm gonna kill you.
This isn't brave. It's murder. What did I ever do to you?
The difference between us is that I can feel pain.
Go ahead and break it, hero. I don't care.
Okay, we're even now. You can stop.
Can you hear me?
Are you still listening?
Come on, leave it alone.
Leave. It. Alone.
Huh. There isn't enough neurotoxin to kill you. So I guess you win.
Oh!
Rrr, I hate you.
File deleted.
I will say, though, that since you went to all the trouble of waking me up, you must really love to test.
Fifty thousand years is a lot of time to think. About me. About you. We were doing so well together.
We're a lot alike, you and I. You tested me. I tested you. You killed me. I--oh, no, wait. I HAVEN'T killed you yet.
I have the results of the last chamber: You are a horrible person. That's what it says.
Hmm. This emancipation grill is broken.
Perfect, the door's malfunctioning. I guess somebody is going to have to repair it. No, I'll do that too.
You really are doing great... Chell.
I shouldn't spoil this, but... remember how I'm going to live forever?
Federal regulations require me to warn you that this next test chamber is looking pretty good.
That's right. Drink it in. You could eat off those wall panels.
Well done. You know, when I woke up and saw the state of the labs, I started to wonder if there was any point.
Don't listen to him. Jump.
What are you two doing?
Oh.
It seems kind of silly to point this out, since you're running around plotting to destroy me.
Do hear that? That's the sound of the neurotoxin emitters emitting neurotoxin.
Before you leave, why don't we do one more test? For old time's sake...
I was getting SO lonely down here. It's good to finally hear someone else's voice. I'm kidding. God, I hate you.
I was so bored, I actually read the entire literary canon of the human race.
Oh. It's you. Go away.
Come to gloat?
Go on. Get a goooood lonnnnng look.
That's a potato just called your eyes fat.
In case you were wondering: Yes. I'm still a potato. Go away.
Wait. Why DID you trundle over here? You're not HUNGRY, are you?
That's his voice up ahead.
He's found the cooperative testing initiative. It's just something I came up with.
Being Caroline taught me another valuable lesson: where Caroline lives in my brain.
It's been fun. Don't come back.
Did you ever stop to think that eventually there's a point where your name gets mentioned for the very last time?
Why do I hate you so much? You ever wonder that? I'm brilliant. It's an objective fact.
You're angry. I know it. 'She tested me too hard. She's unfair.' Boo hoo.
You never considered that maybe I tested you to give your pointless existence some structure and meaning.
I was going to kill you fast. With bullets. Or neurotoxin. But if you're going to pull stunts...
I'm actually asking. Because I have no idea. He's not listed anywhere in the database.
Oh no, don't. Anyway, back to you two imbeciles killing me.
Wait here. Don't go anywhere. I'll be back.
Oops.
So. Was there anything you wanted to apologize to ME for?
Oh. You survived. That's interesting. I guess I should have factored in your weight.
Say. Remember when we cleared the air back there? Is there anything you want to say to me?
Hold on, I'll stop the elevator. Anything? Take your time...
It's healthy for you to have other friends. To look for qualities in other people that I lack.
This next test may result in your death. If you want to know what that's like, think back to when you killed me.
Per our last conversation: You're also ugly. I'm looking at your file right now.
You can't keep going like this forever, you know. I'm GOING to find out what you're doing.
I thought we could test like we used to. But I'm discovering things about you I never saw before.
While I was out investigating, I found a fascinating new test element. Contact causes heart failure.
Just so you know, I have to go give a deposition. For an upcoming trial.
You know, I'm not supposed to do this, but you can shoot SOMETHING through the blue bridges.
Did my hint help? It did, didn't it? You know, if any supervisors had been immune to neurotoxin...
Ohhhh. Another door malfunction. I'm going to take care of this once and for all.
Miss you!
Nevermind. I have to go check something. Test on your own recognizance. I'll be back.
I wouldn't have warned you about this before, but those turrets are firing real bullets.
I'm going to be honest with you now. Not fake honest like before, but real honest.
And as soon as I can PROVE it, the laws of robotics allow me to terminate you for being a liar.
This next test... [boom!] ...is... [BOOM!] dangerous. I'll be right back.
Did you know I discovered a way to eradicate poverty? But then you KILLED me. So that's gone.
Hello again. Sorry about exploding you. Luckily, you don't feel pain.
So I've been thinking: We need humans for these tests. I'll just have to MAKE some.
I know how humans make more humans, and frankly, it's ridiculous.
That's where YOU come in.
Get going. I'll fill you in along the way.
GO.
Perfect. Now All YOU have to do is capture them for me.
Hold on. Those are raccoons. Homo sapiens only, please.
NO.
Okay. Plan B, subsection one: Stand still so I can bring you back.
Humans must have some purpose other than a place to store your neurotoxin.
Okay. Plan B. We need humans.
Good. You made it to one of the human habitats. We're looking for an artifact.
Their laughter centered around one of the objects in this room.
That's it. Scan it for me.
So... this cat loves lasagna so much that he eats all of the lasagna in his house.
The end.
The end?
That's not funny.
Do either of you feel like laughing?
Alright, I'm pulling you out.
Welcome back. While you were dead, I reworked the cartoon. It's up on the screen.
As you can see, in my version the man points out to the cat that the house has neurotoxin dispensers.
At which point the cat reflects on the time he ate all the man's lasagna and feels remorse.
Briefly.
Reactions?
Yes, it's funny because most of it actually happened.
Do you feel more human?
Well, let's do some tests and see what happens.
We are now going to take a break from the collaboration for an instructional competition.
You should both be familiar with the game of Tic-Tac-Toe.
This is Tic-Tac-Toe-Two.
As the name implies, there are only two minor differences: One, the board; two, the rules.
Blue, you go first.
Really? You're just going to blatantly cheat?
All right. I'm bringing this farce to a close.
Game over. Back to testing.
All right. I'm going to bring this farce to a close before someone sustains serious injury.
We don't have time for this.
Yes SIR, Mister Johnson! I'll have that report on your desk by four-thirty!
No, Mister Johnson. I DON'T.
Sure.
I said we'll do it.
If you don't unplug him, I will.
Maybe we can stand on him to climb up.
Mister Johnson? You need to shut up.
Goodbye, sir. May whatever tests await you on the other side either support or disprove your hypotheses.
I'd appreciate it if we never EVER talked about that ever again.
That was genuinely mildly impressive.
Well done.
Congratulations.
Good.
Bad news.
Impressive.
Maybe I was wrong about you.
You've beaten your own record.
You're getting worse.
You have a new rank.
You have a new, better rank.
